title: Getting started
text: PCS codes composed seven alphanumeric characters. character contains 34 possible values. seven characters make complete code specific meanings vary 17 sections manual. value represents specific option general character definition. 10 digits (0-9) 24 letters (-H, J-N, P-Z) may used character. letters O used avoid confusion digits 0 1.

title: Getting started
text: character axis classification specifies information procedure performed. Within defined code range, character specifies type information axis classification. example, fifth axis classification specifies Approach sections 0 4 7 9 system.

title: Getting started
code: pcs("0016070") |> gt_pcs() x <- pcs("0016070") x$axes |> gt(rowname_col = "axis") |> opt_table_font(font = google_font(name = "Rubik")) |> cols_align(align = "center", columns = c(axis, value)) |> tab_style(style = list(cell_fill(color = "lightgray", alpha = 0.5), cell_text(weight = "bold")), locations = cells_body(columns = value)) |> opt_all_caps() |> tab_header(title = html("ICD-10-PCS 2024"), subtitle = html(paste0("", x$code, ": ", x$description))) |> tab_footnote( footnote = html(paste0("Definition: ", fuimus::delister(x$definitions[1, 2]))), locations = cells_body(columns = label, rows = 3)) |> tab_footnote( footnote = html(paste("Includes:", fuimus::delister(x$includes[1, 5]))), locations = cells_body(columns = label, rows = 4)) |> tab_footnote( footnote = html(paste0("Definition: ", fuimus::delister(x$definitions[2, 2]))), locations = cells_body(columns = label, rows = 5)) |> tab_options( table.width = pct(75), heading.title.font.size = px(20), heading.subtitle.font.size = px(14), heading.align = "left", table.font.color = "#0B0B45", footnotes.font.size = px(12))

title: Return ICD-10-PCS Code as a gt Table — gt_pcs
code: pcs("0G9000Z") |> gt_pcs()     0G9000Z Drainage of Pituitary Gland with Drainage Device, Open Approach     ICD-10-PCS 2024     1 Section 0 Medical and Surgical2 Body System G Endocrine System3 Operation 9 Drainagea4 Body Part 0 Pituitary Gland5 Approach 0 Openb6 Device 0 Drainage Device7 Qualifier Z No Qualifiera Definition: Taking or letting out fluids and/or gases from a body part. The qualifier DIAGNOSTIC is used to identify drainage procedures that are biopsies.     b Definition: Cutting through the skin or mucous membrane and any other body layers necessary to expose the site of the procedure      gt_pcs(pcs("0016070"))     0016070 Bypass Cerebral Ventricle to Nasopharynx with Autologous Tissue Substitute, Open Approach     ICD-10-PCS 2024     1 Section 0 Medical and Surgical2 Body System 0 Central Nervous System and Cranial Nerves3 Operation 1 Bypassa4 Body Part 6 Cerebral Ventricle5 Approach 0 Openb6 Device 7 Autologous Tissue Substitute7 Qualifier 0 Nasopharynxa Definition: Altering the route of passage of the contents of a tubular body part. Rerouting contents of a body part to a downstream area of the normal route, to a similar route and body part, or to an abnormal route and dissimilar body part. Includes one or more anastomoses, with or without the use of a device.     b Definition: Cutting through the skin or mucous membrane and any other body layers necessary to expose the site of the procedure
